meta.title: Berlin Travel Guide – Best Time to Visit, Things to Do & Tips
meta.description: Discover Berlin with our complete travel guide. Explore top attractions, neighborhoods, food spots, best time to visit, and local tips.

hero.title: Berlin Travel Guide
hero.subtitle: History, culture, nightlife, and modern creativity
hero.intro: Berlin is a city where history and modern culture coexist. From iconic landmarks and world-class museums to underground nightlife and creative neighborhoods, Berlin offers something for every traveler.

image.alt: Berlin skyline with Brandenburg Gate at sunset

bestTimeToVisit.summary: The best time to visit Berlin is from May to September when the weather is mild and the city comes alive with festivals and outdoor events.

seasons.name: Spring
seasons.description: Pleasant weather, blooming parks, fewer tourists.

seasons.name: Summer
seasons.description: Warm temperatures, festivals, open-air clubs, peak tourist season.

seasons.name: Autumn
seasons.description: Cooler weather, cultural events, and beautiful fall colors.

seasons.name: Winter
seasons.description: Christmas markets, museums, and fewer crowds.

sections.title: Getting Around Berlin
sections.content: Berlin has one of the best public transport systems in Europe, including U-Bahn, S-Bahn, buses, and trams. A day pass offers unlimited travel and is ideal for tourists.

sections.title: Top Neighborhoods to Explore
sections.content: Each Berlin neighborhood has a unique vibe. Mitte is historic and central, Kreuzberg is vibrant and multicultural, Prenzlauer Berg is relaxed and family-friendly, while Friedrichshain is known for nightlife.

sections.title: Food & Local Cuisine
sections.content: Berlin is famous for its street food culture. Try Currywurst, Döner Kebab, and explore international cuisine from around the world.

thingsToDo.title: Brandenburg Gate
thingsToDo.description: One of Berlin’s most iconic landmarks and a symbol of German unity.

thingsToDo.title: Berlin Wall Memorial
thingsToDo.description: Learn about the history of the Berlin Wall and its impact on the city.

thingsToDo.title: Museum Island
thingsToDo.description: A UNESCO World Heritage site featuring five world-class museums.

thingsToDo.title: East Side Gallery
thingsToDo.description: The longest remaining section of the Berlin Wall, covered in murals.

thingsToDo.title: Kreuzberg Nightlife
thingsToDo.description: Experience Berlin’s famous nightlife in Kreuzberg’s clubs and bars.

faq.question: Is Berlin expensive to visit?
faq.answer: Berlin is generally more affordable than many other European capitals, especially when it comes to food, transport, and attractions.

faq.question: How many days are enough for Berlin?
faq.answer: Three to four days are enough to explore major attractions, museums, and neighborhoods.

faq.question: Is Berlin good for solo travelers?
faq.answer: Yes, Berlin is considered safe and welcoming for solo travelers, with excellent public transport and diverse activities.
